newsitem.title: USA: Informix gets $40 mln equity investment.
newsitem.headline: Informix gets $40 mln equity investment.

text.p: Informix Corp said Wednesday it received a $40 million equity investment from Fletcher International Ltd.
Informix said it plans to use the proceeds in its operations as it works to get the company "back on track towards profitability."

The company said it sold 160,000 shares of newly issued series A convertible preferred stock for $40 million, and issued a warrant to acquire up to an additional 140,000 shares of series A convertible preferred stock for up to $35 million.

The series A convertible preferred stock is convertible into common stock any time after issuance and will automatically convert into common stock 18 months following the date of its issuance by Informix.
The number of shares of common stock to be issued upon conversion will vary based on future stock price movements.
The exercise price for the series A convertible preferred stock related to the warrant is $250 per share of series A convertible preferred stock.
Informix said Hambrecht & Quist LLC served as placement agent on this transaction.
